main event: On 7 May 1952 in Topeka, Kansas, 1LT. DONALD C. KEYS, USAF, observed an unidentified object traveling at a high rate of speed at about 45,000 feet. The object was circular in shape, metallic in appearance, and estimated to be 50-60 feet in diameter.
interesting points: The object was observed through 6 X 50 binoculars for approximately 45 seconds before accelerating in speed.
Coordinated investigation revealed no conventional aircraft in the area at the time of the sighting.
The observer was a 1LT. in the USAF, adding credibility to the sighting.
The report was downgraded at 12-year intervals and not automatically declassified.
The sighting was visually observed with a high level of detail, including specific estimated coordinates.
sighted object: circular, metallic object estimated to be 50-60 feet in diameter
